00037 /*! File not specified exception */
00038 #define FILE_NOT_SPECIFIED 0
00039 
00040 /*! File not found exception */
00041 #define FILE_NOT_FOUND 1
00042 
00043 /*! Unable to read the file. */
00044 #define READ_ERROR 2
00045 
00046 /*! A string message corresponding to the error codes. */
00047 static const char *error_string[] =
00048 {
00049         "The CDF file was not specified",
00050         "The CDF file does not exist",
00051         "Unable to read the CDF file"
00052 };
00053 
00054 void define_aptcdfexport_options(PgOptions* opts)
00055 {
00056   opts->setUsage("This program will output the probe set information stored in a CDF file.\n"
00057                  "usage:\n"
00058                  "   apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf -ps probeset1 -ps probeset2 -ps probeset3 ...\n"
00059                  "     or\n"
00060                  "   apt-cdf-export -c myCdfFile.cdf\n"
00061                  "     for all probesets.");
00062   // generic options
00063   opts->defOpt("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00064                "This help message.",
00065                "false");
00066   opts->defOpt("", "version", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00067                "Display version information.",
00068                "false");
00069 
00070   // Action options
00071   opts->defOpt("","export",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00072                "export a CDF file.",
00073                "false");
00074 
00075   opts->defOpt("","file-md5",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00076                "compute the MD5 of the entire file.",
00077                "false");
00078 
00079   // 
00080   opts->defOpt("c", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00081                "The full path to the CDF file.",
00082                "");
00083   opts->defOptMult("", "ps", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00084                    "The name of a probe set. "
00085                    "Repeat for each probe set to output, or omit for all probe sets.",
00086                    "");
00087   
00088 }
00089 
00090 /*! The options for the program. */
00091 typedef struct _Options
00092 {
00093         string file;                    /*! The name of the CDF file. */
00094         map<string, bool> sets; /*! The name of probe sets to extract. */
00095 } Options; /*! The options for the program. */
00096 
00097 
00098 /*! Gets the name of the input CDF file from the command line.
00099  * @param opts PgOptions object describing the command line arguments.
00100  * @param options The program options.
00101  */
00102 static void get_options(PgOptions& opts, Options &options)
00103 {
00104         // get the required arguments
00105         options.file = opts.get("cdf-file");
00106   //
00107   PgOpt* psOpt = opts.mustFindOpt("ps");
00108   for (int i=0;i<psOpt->getValueCount();i++) {
00109     options.sets[psOpt->getValue(i)] = true;
00110   }
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*! Reads the CDF file.
00114  * @param options The program options.
00115  * @param cdf The CDF file object to fill.
00116  * @exception FILE_NOT_FOUND, READ_ERROR
00117  */
00118 static void read_file(const Options &options, CCDFFileData &cdf)
00119 {
00120         cdf.SetFileName(options.file.c_str());
00121         if (cdf.Exists() == false)
00122                 throw FILE_NOT_FOUND;
00123 
00124         if (cdf.Read() == false)
00125                 throw READ_ERROR;
00126 }
00127 
00128 /*! Output the probe set information.
00129  * @param name The probe set name.
00130  * @param set The probe set information.
00131  */
00132 static void output_set(const string &name, CCDFProbeSetInformation &set)
00133 {
00134         CCDFProbeGroupInformation group;
00135         CCDFProbeInformation cel;
00136 
00137         cout << "#probe_set_name\t" << name << endl;
00138         cout << "#probe_set_type\t";
00139         switch (set.GetProbeSetType())
00140         {
00141         case affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType:
00142                 cout << "expression" << endl;
00143                 break;
00144 
00145         case affxcdf::GenotypingProbeSetType:
00146                 cout << "genotyping" << endl;
00147                 break;
00148 
00149         case affxcdf::ResequencingProbeSetType:
00150                 cout << "resequencing" << endl;
00151                 break;
00152 
00153         case affxcdf::TagProbeSetType:
00154                 cout << "tag" << endl;
00155                 break;
00156 
00157         default:
00158                 cout << "unknown" << endl;
00159                 break;
00160         }
00161         cout << "#num_groups\t" << set.GetNumGroups() << endl;
00162         cout << endl;
00163 
00164         int ng = set.GetNumGroups();
00165         for (int ig=0; ig<ng; ig++)
00166         {
00167                 set.GetGroupInformation(ig, group);
00168                 cout << "#group_index\t" << ig << endl;
00169                 cout << "#group_name\t" << group.GetName() << endl;
00170                 cout << "#direction\t" << (group.GetDirection() == affxcdf::AntiSenseDirection ? "Antisense" : "Sense") << endl;
00171                 cout << "#num_cells\t" << group.GetNumCells() << endl;
00172                 
00173                 int nc = group.GetNumCells();
00174                 cout << "#cell_header\t" << "x\t" << "y\t" << "expos\t" << "pbase\t" << "tbase\t" << "atom" << endl;
00175                 for (int ic=0; ic<nc; ic++)
00176                 {
00177                         group.GetCell(ic, cel);
00178                         cout <<
00179                                 cel.GetX() << "\t" <<
00180                                 cel.GetY() << "\t" <<
00181                                 cel.GetExpos() << "\t" <<
00182                                 cel.GetPBase() << "\t" <<
00183                                 cel.GetTBase() << "\t" <<
00184                                 cel.GetListIndex() << endl;
00185                 }
00186                 cout << endl;
00187         }
00188 }
00189 
00190 /*! Determines if the probe set should be output.
00191  * @param name The probe set name.
00192  * @param options The program options.
00193  * @return true if the probe set should be displayed.
00194  */
00195 static bool output_set(const string &name, const Options &options)
00196 {
00197         if (options.sets.empty())
00198                 return true;
00199 
00200         map<string, bool>::const_iterator pos = options.sets.find(name);
00201         return (pos != options.sets.end());
00202 }
00203 
00204 /*! Outputs the data to the command line.
00205  * @param options The program options.
00206  * @param cdf The CDF file object.
00207  */
00208 static void output_data(const Options &options, CCDFFileData &cdf)
00209 {
00210         CCDFProbeSetInformation set;
00211 
00212         // Loop over all probe sets and output the data.
00213         int ns = cdf.GetHeader().GetNumProbeSets();
00214         cout << "#num_probe_sets\t" << ns << endl << endl;
00215         for (int is=0; is<ns; is++)
00216         {
00217                 string name = cdf.GetProbeSetName(is);
00218 
00219                 // Output the set.
00220                 if (output_set(name, options) == true)
00221                 {
00222                         cdf.GetProbeSetInformation(is, set);
00223                         output_set(name, set);
00224                 }
00225         }
00226 }
00227 
00228 /*! The main entry point. This application will extract information from a CDF file
00229  *  and print the contents to the command line.
00230  * @param argc The number of command line arguments
00231  * @param argv The command line arguments
00232  * @return 0 if successful.
00233  */
00234 int main(int argc, char ** argv)
00235 {
00236   try {
00237     const string version = AptVersionInfo::versionToReport();
00238 
00239         try
00240         {
00241                 // Get the program options.
00242                 PgOptions opts;
00243     define_aptcdfexport_options(&opts);
00244                 opts.parseArgv(argv);
00245 
00246                 if (opts.getBool("help")||(argc == 1)) {
00247                         opts.usage();
00248                         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00249                         return 0;
00250                 }
00251 
00252     if (opts.getBool("version")) {
00253                         cout << "version: " << version << endl;
00254                         return 0;
00255                 }
00256 
00257     if (opts.getBool("file-md5")) {
00258       affx::md5sum md5sum;
00259       std::string file_path;
00260       std::string file_md5;
00261       int err_cnt=0;
00262 
00263       for (int i=0;i<opts.getArgCount();i++) {
00264         file_path=opts.getArg(i);
00265         int rv=md5sum.ofFile(file_path,file_md5);
00266         {
00267           cout << file_path << ": ";
00268           if (rv==0) {
00269             cout << file_md5;
00270           }
00271           else {
00272             cout << " error=" << rv;
00273             err_cnt++;
00274           }
00275           cout << endl;
00276         }
00277       }
00278       return ((err_cnt==0)?0:-1);
00279     }
00280 
00281 
00282     // "--export" option.
00283                 Options options;
00284                 get_options(opts, options);
00285 
00286                 // Read the file
00287                 CCDFFileData cdf;
00288                 read_file(options, cdf);
00289 
00290                 // Output the data to the command line.
00291                 output_data(options, cdf);
00292         }
00293         catch (int err)
00294         {
00295         Err::errAbort(error_string[err]);
00296         }
00297 
00298         return 0;
00299   } 
00300   catch(...) {
00301       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00302       return 1;
00303   }
00304   return 1;
00305 }
